attributes.description: Accuracy of the navigation system to determine position under all conditions.
attributes.name: positionAccuracy

attributes.description: Frequency at which the navigation system updates its data.
attributes.name: updateFrequency

attributes.description: Redundancy policy ensuring safe navigation even in failure scenarios.
attributes.name: redundancyPolicy

attributes.description: Signal frequencies employed for satellite and communication links.
attributes.name: signalFrequencies
attributes.value: L5 band for GNSS; X/Ka bands for data communication

designScenario.description: The Navigation System is a sophisticated avionics suite aimed at delivering rapid and precise positional data and route guidance for aircraft operations, ensuring reliability and safety under diverse flight conditions.
designScenario.name: Next-Generation Aircraft Navigation System

details.description: Process and resolve current plane coordinates using onboard sensors and external GNSS data.
Compute optimal path traversing air traffic and meteorological conditions.
Achieve relative positional accuracy within ±3 meters under standard atmospheric interference.
Data processing adaptations to function seamlessly under latency constraints of up to 50 milliseconds.
Backup modules must seamlessly switch upon detecting primary unit malfunction.
Notify pilots of redundant system activation along with potential operational impacts.
Provide pilots with a customized and dynamically updating navigation display.
Incorporate remote diagnostic access for streamlined maintenance and error resolution.

relationships.description: The flight data module integrates synchronized measurements from multiple onboard sensors.
The Communication Interface streams external advisory into the system for real-time processing.
Navigation computer modules consolidate and refine multiple input data.
Critical alerts from Safety Systems direct updates directly to the pilot interface display.

systemComponents.description: Core processor executing navigation computations and data integrations.
systemComponents.name: Advanced Navigation Computer

subComponents.description: Primary data integration module synchronizing multiple input sources.
subComponents.name: Integration Controller

subComponents.description: Performance monitoring unit controlling operational health levels of submodules.
subComponents.name: Health Monitor

systemComponents.description: Devices managing primary signal and sensory data relevant to flight tasks.
systemComponents.name: Advanced Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Antennas specifically tuned for L-band transmissions from satellites.
subComponents.name: Satellite Signal Antenna

subComponents.description: High-precision instrument measuring velocity and directional parameters.
subComponents.name: Velocity Tracker

systemComponents.description: A repository for the maintenance and logic of situational awareness.
systemComponents.name: Dynamic Flight Map Repository

subComponents.description: Controlling storage mechanisms ensuring consistent aerodrome and airspace updates.
subComponents.name: Flight Area Updater

subComponents.description: Logic array dynamically translating enqueued maps into pilot-usable advisories.
subComponents.name: Translation Engine

systemComponents.description: Module enabling external interaction for situational adaptability.
systemComponents.name: Communication Interface Module

subComponents.description: Wireless controls enabling satellite link operability.
subComponents.name: Link Controllers

subComponents.description: Hardware interfacing weather and danger information.
subComponents.name: Hazard Interface

requirements.name: Positional Accuracy Requirement
requirements.text: The system shall ensure positional accuracy of less than 10 meters under operation.

rag_context: The GPS System information and specifications include details about the positional accuracy, data update rate, redundancy level, and frequency bands used for satellite and communication signal reception. It is designed to provide precise location tracking, real-time situational awareness, and reliable navigation in airborne conditions. The system integrates multiple sensor inputs, redundancy protocols, and real-time communication to ensure safe and efficient flight routes while addressing environmental and operational factors.
